sub_topic: Calculation of Carnot efficiency of a heat engine
message_1: An ideal heat engine operates between two reservoirs at temperatures 400 K and 300 K. Calculate the Carnot efficiency of the engine.
message_2:
The Carnot efficiency is the maximum efficiency that any heat engine can achieve when operating between two reservoirs at temperatures T1 (hot reservoir) and T2 (cold reservoir). It is given by the formula:

Carnot efficiency = 1 - (T2 / T1)

In this case, T1 = 400 K (hot reservoir) and T2 = 300 K (cold reservoir). Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Carnot efficiency = 1 - (300 K / 400 K)

Carnot efficiency = 1 - 0.75

Carnot efficiency = 0.25

So, the Carnot efficiency of the ideal heat engine operating between the two reservoirs at temperatures 400 K and 300 K is 25%.
